meanings.definition: To strike or hit with the hand or a blunt instrument.
meanings.sent1: She nobbles the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: He nobbles the ball with his bat during the game.
meanings.sent3: The chef nobbles the dough to shape it into a perfect circle.
meanings.sent4: The waves nobble the boat gently as it rocks back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter nobbles the pieces of wood together to build a sturdy table.

meanings.sent1: She noticed a nobbles on the surface of the fruit.
meanings.sent2: The pillow had a nobbles that made it uncomfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the nobbles on the rug, batting them around.
meanings.sent4: The nobbles on the tree bark created a rough texture to touch.
meanings.sent5: The nobbles on the sweater added a unique texture to the fabric.

meanings.sent1: He nobbles the cards expertly during the magic trick.
meanings.sent2: She nobbles the paintbrush with precision to create detailed artwork.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic nobbles the engine parts to fix the car.
meanings.sent4: The musician nobbles the strings of the guitar to produce beautiful music.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor nobbles the clay into intricate shapes for the sculpture.
